item.title: ./missing-semester from MIT
item.description: Material 2020 Lectures · the missing semester of your cs education 2020 Lectures Course overview + the shell Basic shell script commands (CRUD) Shell Tools and Scripting Editors (Vim) Data Wrangling Command-line Environment Version Control (Git) Debugging and Profiling Metaprogramming Security and Cryptography Potpourri Q&A Video recordings of the lectures are available on YouTube

item.title: MIT 6.000x on edX
item.description: [COMPLETED] Materials Computational Thinking using Python XSeries Program | edX 6.0001 6.0002 Course overview This course is focusing on introducing programming concepts and basic algorithms. It has a similar position with CS50 of Harvard but I felt that it’s more related to my purpose in order to check if any missing parts on python programming. Lecture is available on both Youtube and edX. I like Youtube version more though. Assignment and exam is similar but edX version is a bit easier than offline class materials.
